22q11: band 11 of long arm of chromosome 22
A-aDO2: alveolar arterial O2 difference of each
A&E: Accident and Emergency (phasing out in favour of Emergency Dept)
A2: aortic component of second heart sound
AACAP: American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry
AAO-HNS: American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery
AAOMS: American Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons
AASLD: American Association for the Study of Liver Disease
AAST: American Association for the Surgery of Trauma
ABAS-3: Adaptive Behavior Assessment System, Third Edition
ABCA3: ATP binding cassette subfamily A member 3
ABIC: age, serum bilirubin, international normalized ratio, and serum creatinine
ABLLS-R: Assessment of Basic Language and Learning Skills, Revised
ABOi-LDKT: ABO blood group-incompatible live-donor kidney transplantation
ACOG: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists
ACUTE: Center for Eating Disorders and Severe Malnutrition at Denver Health
ADEM-MOGAD: acute disseminated encephalomyelitis-myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein antibody-associated disease
ADOS-2: Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule, Second Edition
AECOPD: acute exacerbations of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
AHRQ: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality
AIUM: American Institute of Ultrasound in Medicine
ALL: / AML Acute Lymphoblastic Leukaemia / Acute Myeloid Leukaemia
ALSFRS: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Functional Rating Scale
ALSFRS-R: Revised Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Functional Rating Scale
APRI: aspartate aminotransferase to platelet ratio index
ASAS 20/40/50/70: Assessment in Ankylosing Spondylitis response criteria 20/40/50/70
ASD: Atrial Septal Defect AXR Abdominal X-Ray bd/bid Twice a Day BCC Basal Cell Carcinoma
ASIA A: complete spinal injury impairment; no sensory or motor function is preserved in sacral segments S4-S5
ASIA B: incomplete spinal injury impairment; sensory, but not motor, function is preserved below the neurologic level and extends through sacral segments S4-S5
ASIA C: incomplete spinal injury impairment; motor function is preserved below the neurologic level, and most key muscles below the neurologic level have a muscle grade of less than 3
ASIA D: incomplete spinal injury impairment; motor function is preserved below the neurologic level, and most key muscles below the neurologic level have a muscle grade that is greater than or equal to 3
ASIA E: spine is normal; sensory and motor functions are normal
ASIPP: American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians
ASMBS: American Society for Metabolic and Bariatric Surgery
ASPN: American Society of Pain and Neuroscience
ASRA: American Society of Regional Anesthesia and Pain Medicine
ASSFN: American Society of Stereotactic and Functional Neurosurgery
AUB-M: abnormal uterine bleeding - malignancy and hyperplasia
AUB-N: abnormal uterine bleeding - not yet classified
AVRMVR: aortic valve repair or replacement mitral valve repair or replacement
BASDAI: Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Index
BIBEMS: brought in by emergency medical services
BOADICEA: Breast and Ovarian Analysis of Disease Incidence and Carrier Estimation Algorithm
BRAF: v-Rapidly Accelerated Fibrosarcoma murine sarcoma viral oncogene homolog B
BRAT: bananas, rice, apple sauce, and toast (or tea)
CADASIL: cerebral autosomal dominant arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leucoencephalopathy
CALOCUS: Child and Adolescent Level of Care Utilization System
CANVAS: cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, vestibular areflexia syndrome
CASII: Child and Adolescent Service Intensity Instrument
CASL-2: Comprehensive Assessment of Spoken Language, Second Edition
CATCH: Consult for Addiction Treatment and Care in Hospitals
CCPDMA: complete circumferential peripheral and deep margin assessment
CDC: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
CDHIS: Crohn's Disease Histological Index of Severity
CEAP: clinical condition, etiology, anatomic location, pathophysiology
CHA2DS2-VASc: congestive heart failure, hypertension, age ≥ 75, diabetes mellitus, prior stroke or TIA or thromboembolism, vascular disease, age 65-74, sex category
CHARGE: Coloboma, Heart defect, Atresia choanae, Retarded growth and development, Genital hypoplasia, and Ear anomalies/deafness
China CDC: Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention
CHOP INTEND: Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia Infant Test of Neuromuscular Disorders
COACH: Cerebellar vermis hypoplasia, Oligophrenia, Ataxia, Coloboma, and Hepatic fibrosis
CRISPR: clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats
CRT-D: cardiac resynchronization therapy with a defibrillator
CSF2RA: colony stimulating factor 2 receptor subunit alpha
CSF2RB: colony stimulating factor 2 receptor subunit beta
CTAP: computerized tomography of the abdomen and pelvis
CURB-65: confusion, BUN, respiration rate, BP, Age 65+
D5 1/2NS: 5% dextrose in half amount of normal saline
DASH: Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand
DRESS: drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms
DSM: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders
EASL: European Association for the Study of the Liver
ECOG-PS: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status
EDACS: Eating and Drinking Ability Classification System
EMGGG: electromyographic activity of the genioglossus muscle
EORTC QLQ H&N35: European Organisation For Research And Treatment Of Cancer Head and Neck Quality of Life Questionnaire 35
EPOCH: Etoposide, Prednisolone, Oncovin: vincristine, Cyclophosphamide, Hydroxydaunorubicin: doxorubicin
ETANTR: embryonal tumors with abundant neuropil and true rosettes
F-VASI50: 50% improvement in the Facial Vitiligo Area Scoring Index
F-VASI75: 75% improvement in the Facial Vitiligo Area Scoring Index
F-VASI90: 90% improvement in the Facial Vitiligo Area Scoring Index
FAST: focused assessment with sonography in trauma
FEHM: Similac Generation 1 Concentrated Liquid Fortifier [Kosher] + Neosure
FIGO: Federation Internationale de Gynecolgie et d'Obstetrique
GARS-2: Gilliam Autism Rating Scale, Second Edition
GLILD: granulomatous and lymphocytic interstitial lung disease
GNAS: guanine nucleotide binding protein, alpha stimulating
GRADE: Grading of Recommendations, Assessment, Development, and Evaluations
HAS-BLED: hypertension, abnormal renal and liver function, stroke, bleeding, labile INR, elderly, drugs or alcohol
hCFTR: human cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator
HDFN: hemolytic disease of the fetus and newborn
HEART: History, EKG, Age, Risk factors, initial Troponin
HESX1: homeobox expressed in embryonic stem cells 1
HFpEF: heart failure with preserved ejection fraction
HFrEF: heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
HIPAA: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
HNSCC: head and neck squamous cell carcinoma
HoLEP: holmium laser enucleation of the prostate
HOMA-IR: homeostatic model assessment of insulin resistance
Hyper-CVAD: hyperfractionated cyclophosphamide, vincristine, Adriamycin, and dexamethasone
ICD: Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (or Internal Cardiac Defibrillator)
IDEEL: Impact of Dry Eye on Everyday Life
IFSO: International Federation for the Surgery of Obesity and Metabolic Disorders
ILST: independent living skills and training services
IPSET-Thrombosis: International Prognostic Score of Thrombosis for ET
ISASS: International Society for the Advancement of Spine Surgery
IT: time from symptom onset to coronary intervention
IVL-DCB: drug-coated balloon angioplasty with adjunct intravascular lithotripsy
JAK-STAT: janus kinase, signal transducer and activator of transcription protein
JAMA: Journal of the American Medical Association
JBJS: The Journal of Bone & Joint Surgery
K0: No ability or potential to ambulate or transfer safely with or without assistance; A prosthesis does not enhance quality of life or mobility
K1: Able or potential to use a prosthesis for transfers or ambulation on level surfaces at fixed cadence
K2: Ability or potential to ambulate; Ability to traverse low level environmental barriers
K3: Ability or potential to ambulate with variable cadence
K4: Ability or potential for prosthetic ambulation that exceeds basic ambulation skills, exhibiting high impact, stress, or energy levels
KRAS: Kirsten rat sarcoma viral oncogene homolog
LA classification: Los Angeles Classification of Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease
LAD-D1: left anterior descending artery - first diagonal branch
LAD-D2: left anterior descending artery - second diagonal branch
LAD-D3: left anterior descending artery - third diagonal branch
LAVH BSO: Laparoscopic-assisted vaginal hysterectomy with BSO Bilateral Salpingo-Oophorectomy
Li-RADS: Liver Imaging Reporting and Data System
LOCADTR: Level of Care for Alcohol and Drug Treatment Referral
logMAR: logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution
Lung-RADS: Lung Imaging Reporting and Data System
m-VEINES-QOL/Sym: modified Venous Insufficiency Epidemiological and Economic Study-Quality of Life/Symptoms
M4: terminal or cortical segments, middle cerebral artery
MAC-ELISA: monoclonal antibody capture enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay
MAUDE: Manufacturer and User Facility Device Experience
MELAS: mitochondrial encephalopathy, lactic acidosis, and stroke-like episodes
MELD: Model for End Stage Liver Disease
MERRF: myoclonic epilepsy with ragged red fibers
METS: Measurement of Exercise Tolerance before Surgery
MG-ADL: Myasthenia Gravis Activities of Daily Living
MIrAVR: minimally invasive reoperative aortic valve replacement
MITESE: minimally invasive tissue excision with possible redundant skin excision
MLD MAX: Morphology, Length, Diameter, Medial dissection, Apposition, eXpansion
MMLV-RT: Moloney murine leukemia virus reverse transcriptase
MS: Multiple Sclerosis (Write in full: Mitral Stenosis)
MSK-IMPACT: Memorial Sloan-Kettering integrated mutation profiling of actionable cancer targets
MSU: Mid-Stream Urine Sample (for culture and sensitivity)
N0: Regional lymph node stage - There is no cancer in nearby lymph nodes
NASPGHAN: North American Society For Pediatric Gastroenterology, Hepatology & Nutrition
NHLBI: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute
NIAAA: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism
NIHSS: National Institutes of Health stroke scale
NLRP12: Nucleotide-Binding Oligomerization Domain, Leucine Rich Repeat And Pyrin Domain Containing 12
NRAS: neuroblastoma Rat sarcoma virus viral oncogene homolog
NX: Regional lymph node stage - Cancer in nearby lymph nodes cannot be measured
OASAS: New York Office of Addiction Services and Supports
OPLL: ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament
ORIF: Open Reduction and Internal Fixation (of fracture)
PALM-COEIN: polyp; adenomyosis; leiomyoma; malignancy and hyperplasia; coagulopathy; ovulatory dysfunction; endometrial; iatrogenic; and not yet classified
PANDAS: Pediatric Autoimmune Neuropsychiatric Disorders Associated with Streptococcal Infections
PASI100: 100% reduction in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index score
PASI50: 50% reduction in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index score
PASI75: 75% reduction in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index score
PASI90: 90% reduction in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index score
PCR-RFLP: polymerase chain reaction–restriction fragment length polymorphism
PDGFRA: platelet derived growth factor receptor alpha
PE-TLIF: percutaneous endoscopic transforaminal lumbar interbody fusion
PEAK-DT: Promoting Emergence of Advanced Knowledge Direct Training
PECARN: Pediatric Emergency Care Applied Research Network
PErFecTED: Proximal Embolization First, Then, Embolize Distal
PERRL: pupils equal round and reactive to light
PERRLA: pupils equal, round, and reactive to light and accommodation
PF: / PEFR Peak Flow / peak expiratory flow rate
PGT-M: preimplantation genetic testing for monogenic disorder
PHEIC: Public Health Emergency of International Concern
PHMM: posterior horn of the medial meniscus
PI-RADS: Prostate Imaging Reporting and Data System
PICOS: Population, Intervention, Control, and Outcome Study
PIVENS: Pioglitazone versus Vitamin E versus Placebo for the Treatment of Non-diabetic patients with Nonalcoholic steatohepatitis
PMI: point of maximum impulse (of the heart)
PRISMA: Preferred Reporting Items for Systematic Reviews and Meta-Analyses
PROP1: homeobox protein prophet of pituitary-specific positive transcription factor 1
PTNS: Percutaneous or Posterior Tibial Nerve Stimulation
R-EPOCH: Rituximab, Etoposide, Prednisolone, Oncovin, Cyclophosphamide, Hydroxydaunorubicin
RAND/UCLA: Research and Development Corporation/University of California at Los Angeles
RANK: receptor activator of nuclear factor kappa-Β
RANKL: Receptor activator of nuclear factor kappa-Β ligand
RANTES: Regulated upon Activation, Normal T Cell Expressed and Presumably Secreted
RAPID3: Routine Assessment of Patient Index Data 3
RECIST: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
ROHHAD: rapid-onset obesity with hypothalamic dysregulation, hypoventilation, and autonomic dysregulation
ROSAH: retinal dystrophy, optic nerve edema, splenomegaly, anhidrosis and migraine headache
rRT-PCR: real-time reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction
RVFWS: RV free wall longitudinal systolic strain
SABR-COMET: Stereotactic Ablative Radiotherapy for the Comprehensive Treatment of Oligometastases
SAGES: Society of American Gastrointestinal and Endoscopic Surgeons
SAMHSA: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
SARA: Scale for the Assessment and Rating of Ataxia
SARS-CoV-2: Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus-2 Virus
SCATS: spinal cord assessment tool for spastic reflexes
SES-CD: Simple Endoscopic Score for Crohn Disease
SIADH: syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion
SLAP: superior labrum from anterior to posterior
SNC1: serum nadir creatinine level in the first year of life
SOX3: Sex Determining Region Y-Box Transcription Factor 3
SS: two copies of sickle hemoglobin β-globin gene
SSED: summary of safety and effectiveness data
SSIL-SEL: Social Skills Improvement System - Social-Emotional Learning Edition
STAT: signal transducer and activator of transcription
STOPAH: Steroids or Pentoxifylline for Alcoholic Hepatitis
SUFU: Society of Urodynamics, Female Pelvic Medicine & Urogenital Reconstruction
T-VASI: total body Vitiligo Area Scoring Index
T-VASI50: 50% improvement in total body Vitiligo Area Scoring Index
T0: Tumor stage - Main tumor cannot be found
T1: prostate cancer nonpalpable and not identified in imaging
T1c: nonpalpable prostate cancer diagnosed by needle biopsy
TAH: ± BSO Total Abdominal Hysterectomy ± Bilateral Salpingo-oophorectomy
TAHBSO: Total Abdominal Hysterectomy and Bilateral Salpingo-Oophorectomy
TCH: Taxotere or Taxol, carboplatin, and Herceptin
TCI: To come in-date or fact that a person is due to be admitted to hospital
ThuLEP: thulium laser enucleation of the prostate
TONIC: treatment of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease in children
TORCH: Toxoplasmosis, Other (syphilis, varicella-zoster, parvovirus B19), Rubella, Cytomegalovirus (CMV), and Herpes
TRAPS: tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated periodic syndrome
TX: Tumor stage - Main tumor cannot be measured
UCBL: University of California Berkeley Laboratories Shoe Insert
upE: region upstream of the E gene
V3: atlas loop segment of vertebral artery
VACTERL: vertebrae, anus, cardiac, tracheoesophageal fistula, renal, limbs
VB-MAPP: Verbal Behavior Milestones Assessment and Placement Program
VBAC: vaginal birth after a previous cesarean delivery
VD-PACE: Velcade, Dexamethasone, Cisplatin, Doxorubicin, Cyclophosphamide, Etoposide
VDRL: Venereal Disease Research Laboratory (serological test for syphilis)
VEINES-QOL/Sym: Venous Insufficiency Epidemiological and Economic Study-Quality of Life/Symptoms
VEO-IBD: Very Early Onset Inflammatory Bowel Disease
VREP: very rare exocrine neoplasm of the pancreas
VVI: ventricle paced, ventricle sensed, pacing is inhibited if beat is sensed
WHCRA: Women’s Health and Cancer Rights Act
WPATH: World Professional Association for Transgender Health
WPPSI-IV: Wechsler Preschool and Primary Scale of Intelligence, Fourth Edition
WRAVMA: Wide Range Assessment of Visual Motor Abilities
yfgn: [this is a proprietary suffix that does not mean anything]
(CHD): (Coronary Heart Disease – Ischaemic Heart Disease preferred)
DNAR: Do Not Attempt Resuscitation (Sometimes written as DNACPR)
ERPC: Evacuation of Retained Products of Conception
GUT: or GUS Genito Urinary Tract/ System
HAV/: HBV / HCV / Hepatitis [A, B, C, D or E] Virus.
MAU: Medical Admissions Unit (for Gateshead EAU now used)
on: At Night (when written next to medication dosing only)
om: In the Morning (when written next to medication dosing only)
PERLA: Pupils equal and reacting to light and accommodation
(PVD): Peripheral Vascular Disease (peripheral arterial disease preferred)
(RTA): Road Traffic Accident (write renal tubular acidosis in full) Note that whilst Road traffic accident is in common use, RTC is the preferred term.
